page.title: 21Down St Mary
page.content: Since 1986, the village of Down St Mary has continued to grow, if only in a small way. However, the facilities have declined. It is many years since the Post Office & Stores was closed. Later the garage took over selling groceries for a while. Eventually, that too closed and is now run as a second-hand car dealership. People have to travel to Crediton for petrol and to Copplestone & Bow for groceries. The adult population of Down, Morchard Road & the outlying farms is 290.
